e4: Not changing to the new policy is recommended because, while inaccurate financial reporting is undesirable, it has become ingrained in investor expectations and the company could face difficulties when transitioning to an unbiased reporting system.
e5: In an ideal reporting policy, I would view honesty and transparency as key characteristics. This means presenting accurate financial information without deliberate distortion or omission, allowing stakeholders to make informed decisions. Another consideration is fairness, ensuring that all investors are treated equally and have access to the same information. Additionally, an ethical reporting policy should be consistent with laws and regulations, avoiding any potential for fines or reputational damage if discovered.
e6: Yes. I would ask about measures being taken to educate investors and stakeholders on the change in reporting policy, particularly among retail investors who may not fully understand the implications of the bias being removed. Additionally, I'd like to know if any safeguards are being put in place to prevent hedge funds from taking advantage of small investors during the transition period.
